name: Methods must have JavaDoc comments
description: When enforcing the utilization of JavaDoc Comments to document an application, all Methods must have JavaDoc Comments. Those comments must be defined just before the declaration of the Method with the appropriate structure (/** */)
output:
This report lists all Methods not having JavaDoc comments.
This report provides the following information:
 Method full name
rationale: There is no dispute that these comments contribute to a developer's understanding and help a developer write reliable applications more quickly. Without documenting methods it is dififcult for anyone else than the author to guess the purpose of the method except by looking at the code and eventually the code called by this method.
